value.0:
From Clebrior's Flora: 

"All parts of the plant are very poisonous, causing vomiting when eaten, and death in larger amounts. 

Gerard Tophunder reports that drinking the seed of larkspur was thought to help against the stings of scorpions, and that other poisonous animals could not move when covered by the herb, but does not believe it himself. Grieve's herbal reports it is used to keep witches from the stables, probably because of its blue color.

Stavesacre, especially the tall variety, is a significant cause of cattle poisoning on rangelands in western Amia. It is more common in high-elevation areas, and many farmers will delay moving cattle onto such ranges until late summer when the toxicity of the plants is reduced."
